body_html:
This has been fixed on master, see below:

In [1]: import torch

In [2]: torch.cuda.is_available()
Out[2]: True

In [3]: torch.tensor([]).mean(0)
Out[3]: tensor(nan)

In [4]: import numpy as np

In [5]: np.array([]).mean(0)
/data/users/gchanan/anaconda3/bin/ipython:1: RuntimeWarning: Mean of empty slice.
  #!/data/users/gchanan/anaconda3/bin/python
/data/users/gchanan/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/_methods.py:80: RuntimeWarning: invalid value encountered in double_scalars
  ret = ret.dtype.type(ret / rcount)
Out[5]: nan

In [6]: torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean(0)
Out[6]: tensor(nan, device='cuda:0')

In [7]: torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean()
Out[7]: tensor(nan, device='cuda:0')

In [8]: torch.tensor([]).mean()
Out[8]: tensor(nan)

body:
This has been fixed on master, see below:
```
In [1]: import torch

In [2]: torch.cuda.is_available()
Out[2]: True

In [3]: torch.tensor([]).mean(0)
Out[3]: tensor(nan)

In [4]: import numpy as np

In [5]: np.array([]).mean(0)
/data/users/gchanan/anaconda3/bin/ipython:1: RuntimeWarning: Mean of empty slice.
  #!/data/users/gchanan/anaconda3/bin/python
/data/users/gchanan/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/numpy/core/_methods.py:80: RuntimeWarning: invalid value encountered in double_scalars
  ret = ret.dtype.type(ret / rcount)
Out[5]: nan

In [6]: torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean(0)
Out[6]: tensor(nan, device='cuda:0')

In [7]: torch.tensor([]).cuda().mean()
Out[7]: tensor(nan, device='cuda:0')

In [8]: torch.tensor([]).mean()
Out[8]: tensor(nan)
```
